title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (LPG
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (LPG 

Safety Licence) Levy Order 2024. 

(2) This Order shall come into operation on 31 December 2024. 

(3) The Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (LPG Safety Licence) Levy Order 

2023 (S.I No. 598 of 2023) is revoked as and from 1 January 2025.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited electricity regulation act 1999 (lpg safety licence) levy order 2024 (2) order shall come operation 31 december 2024 (3) electricity regulation act 1999 (lpg safety licence) levy order 2023 (s.i no 598 2023) revoked 1 january 2025

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: In this Order—
text_raw:
3. 

In this Order— 

(a) 

all words and expressions defined in the Act or in the Act of 2012 
shall have the same meanings when used in this Order and where 
in any case a word or expression used in this Order is defined in 
each of the Act and the Act of 2012, the word or expression shall 
have the meaning given to it by the Act of 2012 for the purposes 
of this Order; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th December, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [671] 3 

(b) 

(c) 

a reference to legislation is a reference to that legislation as 
amended from time to time; and 

a reference to a sub-article is to the sub-article of the provision in 
which the reference occurs.

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 4. (1) A levy of €15.80 per customer for the levy year is hereby imposed on
text_raw:
4. (1) A levy of €15.80 per customer for the levy year is hereby imposed on 
each of the relevant undertakings which hold a LPG safety licence at any point 
during the levy year. 

(2) The levy imposed by sub-article (1) shall be payable in quarterly 
instalments in each case no later than the day which is 30 days after the date on 
which a request for payment of the levy instalment is made by the Commission.
text_norm: 4 (1) levy eur15.80 per customer levy year hereby imposed relevant undertaking hold lpg safety licence point levy year (2) levy imposed sub-article (1) shall payable quarterly instalment case later day 30 day date request payment levy instalment made commission

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 5. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 4 is not paid within
text_raw:
5. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 4 is not paid within 
the period for payment specified in Article 4, interest thereon shall accrue at the 
prescribed interest rate compounded monthly from the date when such payment 
is due until the same is made. 

(2) In this Regulation, "the prescribed interest rate" means a rate 2% per 

annum above the Euribor rate.
text_norm: 5 (1) amount falling paid article 4 paid within period payment specified article 4 interest thereon shall accrue prescribed interest rate compounded monthly date payment due made (2) regulation prescribed interest rate mean rate 2 per annum euribor rate

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 6. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank
text_raw:
6. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank 

transfer or equivalent instantaneous transfer of funds to the bank account 
specified by the Commission. 

(2) Relevant undertakings shall notify the Commission as soon as payment 
has been made, indicating the date on which payment was made and the name 
of the bank effecting payment. 

(3) A request for payment by the Commission to the relevant undertakings 
under this Order shall be made to the relevant undertaking in accordance with 
Section 4 of the Act. 

Sealed with the common seal of the Commission for 
Regulation of Utilities on 4 December, 2024. 

JIM GANNON, 

Chairperson of the Commission. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [671]

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order imposes a levy on a licensed LPG undertaking, for the purpose of 
meeting expenses properly incurred by the Commission for Regulation of 
Utilities in the discharge of its functions under the Act and the Act of 2012.
